snippet: Chuck Hagel’s grilling as nominee for defense secretary was striking in a place where respect for fellow and retired senators of the same party has been more or less a given.
abstract: Chuck Hagel struggles with Senate Republicans' grilling during hearing for his nomination as defense secretary; willingness of Republicans to skewer one of their own shows how old ways of Senate, in which respect for fellow and retired senators of same party was more or less a given, are disappearing.
lead_paragraph: Chuck Hagel’s grilling as nominee for defense secretary was striking in a place where respect for fellow and retired senators of the same party has been more or less a given.

headline.main: In Senate, Traditional Decorum Gives Way to New Discord
headline.print_headline: In Hidebound Senate, Decorum Becomes Less Traditional
